itemDescription: Recipient of the Medal of Honor

wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Eadie (April 8, 1887 – November 14, 1974) was a United States Navy diver and a recipient of America's highest military decoration - the Medal of Honor.

response: During the course of the rescue operation Chief Gunner's Mate Thomas Eadie rescued, at the risk of his own life, a fellow diver, Fred Michels, who became fouled in the wreckage while attempting to attach an air hose to the S-4.  For his heroism Eadie was awarded the Medal of Honor.
* Thomas Eadie Lieutenant (two awards and MOH)

link_mentions.page: Common Burying Ground and Island Cemetery
response: *Lieutenant Thomas Eadie, USN - Medal of Honor recipient (buried in Island Cemetery Annex).
*Thomas Eadie (1887–1974), United States Navy officer, recipient of the Medal of Honor
*Thomas Eadie (1887–1974), U.S. Navy diver and a recipient of the Medal of Honor
